Article Title: After US, Italy and Taiwan, another country ban DeepSeek on government devices
Article Text:
What Australia said on security risks posed by DeepSeek

DeepSeek is now banned in another country. After the US, Italy and Taiwan announced a ban on the The Chinese Al app, Australia has banned DeepSeek from all government devices. The ban stems from concerns that DeepSeek poses security risks.According to a report by news agency Reuters, the country’s Department of Home Affairs issued a mandatory directive requiring all government entities to “prevent the use or installation of DeepSeek products, applications and web services and where found remove all existing instances of DeepSeek products, applications and web services from all Australian Government systems and devices,” according to a government statement.Australian home affairs minister Tony Burke stated that DeepSeek presented an “unacceptable risk” to government technology, and the immediate ban was implemented “to protect Australia’s national security and national interest”. The ban is limited to government devices and does not extend to the devices of private citizens.DeepSeek's launch last month sent shockwaves through the global tech industry, as its AI models reportedly cost significantly less and require less powerful chips than those of its rivals. This development raised concerns about the substantial investments made by Western nations in chipmakers and data centers.Despite the Chinese Al app DeepSeek gaining attention for outperforming OpenAI at a much lower cost, it raised security concerns due to reports of user data being collected and stored in China. This is due to the fact that Chinese law mandates all companies share data with the government upon request, raising fears about potential access to American user data by the country.Australia's decision to ban DeepSeek follows a similar move by Italy, and other countries in Europe and elsewhere are also reportedly scrutinising the AI firm. Taiwan recently banned government departments from using DeepSeek as well.This ban is not the first instance of the Australian government restricting the use of Chinese technology. Two years ago, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's government imposed a government-wide ban on the Chinese social media app TikTok due to security concerns.
Article Summary: Australia has banned DeepSeek from all government devices. The ban stems from concerns that the app poses security risks. It follows a similar move by Italy, and other countries in Europe and elsewhere are also reportedly scrutinising the AI firm. What are NYT Strands and how to play the game?

Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.

To play, connect letters on the grid to form words by dragging your mouse or fingers (on a touchscreen) in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal directions.

Start by identifying the central theme word or Spangram, which will help you understand the puzzle’s theme.

In addition to the Spangram, you must also find other words related to the theme hidden in the grid. Once you’ve uncovered them all, the puzzle is complete.

Tips for solving NYT Strands puzzle

Identify the theme words: Fill in the grid with the theme words. Once found, they will be highlighted in blue and won't overlap with each other.

Find the Spangram: Identify the Spangram, a key part of the puzzle that connects two opposite sides of the grid. It encapsulates the theme and may consist of two words. The Spangram will be highlighted in yellow once you’ve located it.

Take advantage of hints: Pay attention to off-topic words for clues. For every three non-theme words you uncover, letters will be highlighted to give you a hint toward finding a theme word, without directly revealing it.

Article Title: Who is Akash Bobba, the 22-year-old Indian-origin engineer part of Elon Musk's DOGE team

Article Title: China's DeepSeek ban starts in America with the State that an 'angry' Elon Musk moved two of his biggest companies' headquarters to after 'dumping' California
Article Text:
Elon Musk wants to create ‘history’ in Texas with his SpaceX plan



Poll What Should be the Top Priority When Regulating Foreign Tech Companies? Economic Benefits National Security

DeepSeek's global rise

Other Chinese apps and platforms banned



DeepSeek ban has started in the US of A. The first state in the United States of America (USA) to ban China's DeepSeek AI is Texas. The Texas Governor Greg Abbott has issued an order banning the Chinese-owned artificial intelligence app DeepSeek from all State-issued devices. This makes Texas the first State in the US to take such an action.Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued an order banning the Chinese app DeepSeek.Abbott cited concerns about the Chinese Communist Party's potential access to sensitive data of Americans through the AI app. "Texas will not allow the Chinese Communist Party to infiltrate our state’s critical infrastructure through data-harvesting AI and social media apps," Abbott stated. He emphasized the need to protect state agencies and employees handling critical infrastructure, intellectual property, and personal information from "malicious espionage operations." “To achieve that mission, I ordered Texas state agencies to ban Chinese government-based AI and social media apps from all state-issued devices. State agencies and employees responsible for handling critical infrastructure, intellectual property, and personal information must be protected from malicious espionage operations by the Chinese Communist Party. Texas will continue to protect and defend our state from hostile foreign actors,” his statement saidIncidentally, Texas is the state that the world's richest man Elon Musk has moved his company SpaceX's headquarters to. In July last year, Elon Musk announced that he would officially move the headquarters of SpaceX and his social media site X from California to Texas.An upset Musk had then said that the move was in response to a California law prohibiting rules requiring teachers to notify parents if a child changes their name, pronouns, or gender identity at school.SpaceX workers living in Cameron County filed an official petition in January 2025 to hold an election on incorporation later in the month. The document proposes the initial plans for the town and if they translate into reality, Musk will have created history again. The petition outlines a community of roughly 500 residents. These include 219 primary residents and over 100 children. The proposed location, covering about 1.5 square miles, is near Boca Chica Beach at the end of State Highway 4. If approved, Starbase will be able to establish its own police and fire departments and enact its own ordinances.The Chinese AI app DeepSeek gained attention recently for outperforming OpenAI at a much lower cost. However, it has also raised security concerns due to reports of user data being collected and stored in China. Chinese law mandates that companies share data with the government upon request, raising fears about potential access to American user data by the Chinese Communist Party. The US Navy has also blocked DeepSeek due to these concerns.In addition to DeepSeek, the order prohibits several other Chinese social media platforms, including RedNote and Lemon8. It also extends to apps associated with the People’s Republic of China and the Chinese Communist Party, such as Webull, Tiger Brokers, and Moomoo. Notably, Lemon8 is owned by ByteDance, the parent company of TikTok.
Article Summary: Texas Governor Greg Abbott issued an order banning the Chinese app DeepSeek. He cited concerns about the Chinese Communist Party's potential access to sensitive data of Americans through the AI app. Texas is the state that the world's richest man Elon Musk has moved his company SpaceX's headquarters to.

Article Title: This iPhone launched in 2023 is the most-popular smartphone worldwide right now
Article Text: Apple's iPhone 15 claimed the title of world's best-selling smartphone in 2024, leading the year that saw Apple devices capture seven of the top ten spots in global shipments, according to latest reports from Canalys and Counterpoint Research.The base model iPhone 15 secured approximately 3% of the total 1.22 billion smartphones shipped worldwide, translating to roughly 36.6 million units.The iPhone 15 Pro Max and iPhone 15 Pro followed in second and third positions respectively, underscoring Apple's dominance across price tiers.Samsung was the only other manufacturer to break into the top ten, with its Galaxy A15 securing the fourth position. The Korean tech giant's other entries included the Galaxy A15 5G and the flagship Galaxy S24 Ultra, marking the S-series' first appearance in the annual top ten since 2018.Industry analysts attribute the iPhone 15's success to strong sales in key markets like the United States and China, which accounted for nearly half of its global sales. The trend toward premium devices was particularly notable, with Pro models making up more than half of annual iPhone sales for the first time, aided by attractive financing options and trade-in programs.The aging iPhone 13 rounded out the top ten, shipping an estimated 18.3 million units despite being three years old, demonstrating the lasting appeal of Apple's older models. This performance helped Apple capture 1.5% of total global smartphone shipments with just this single model.Looking ahead, analysts predict an increased adoption of AI-capable smartphones in 2025, with manufacturers emphasizing generative AI features in their high-end offerings. Half of 2024's top-selling phones already included such capabilities, suggesting a growing consumer interest in AI-powered devices.
Article Summary: The iPhone 15 secured approximately 3% of the total 1.22 billion smartphones shipped worldwide, translating to roughly 36.6 million units. Samsung was the only other manufacturer to break into the top ten, with its Galaxy A15 securing the fourth position. Half of 2024's top-selling phones already included AI capabilities, suggesting a growing consumer interest in the technology.

Article Title: Panic, as Amazon founder Jeff Bezos visits Caribbean nation; PM Reuben Meade issues statement: Thank God he's ...
Article Text:
Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez (File photo)

PANIC in the Caribbean nation

Prime Minister Reuben Meade says should be thankful to Jeff Bezos

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and fiancee Lauren Sanchez 's recent visit to the Caribbean island of Montserrat aboard his $500 million superyacht, "Koru," reportedly sparked alarm among locals who feared the billionaire was scouting land for purchase. According to a report in Daily Mail, Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's visit on January 6, part of a Caribbean tour that also included St.Kitts and Nevis and St. Barts, prompted a town hall meeting and forced the Prime Minister to address the community's concerns.Locals worried that the world's second-richest man, worth $250 billion, was in Montserrat for business. These concerns were amplified at a United Alliance town hall meeting where Bezos' presence was a key topic. One community member expressed apprehension about the mogul's intentions.Bezos's "Koru," a 417-foot, three-masted sailing yacht built in the Netherlands in 2021, drew considerable attention, with residents sharing photos and videos of the vessel on social media. While some worried about land acquisition, others saw the visit as a potential opportunity for the island, suggesting Bezos could be asked for assistance with local projects like the port or hospital. Some residents also hoped the visit would boost tourism.Prime Minister Reuben Meade, 70, attempted to quell these fears, clarifying that Bezos was visiting as a tourist. "He came here as a tourist," Meade stated, emphasizing the separation between Bezos's personal and business activities. He further explained that Bezos couldn't purchase land without government approval, requiring an "alien land holding license," ensuring transparency in any potential business dealings. "They can't do anything unless they register a business or seek a license to do business. We will know what is happening when the time is right," Meade reassured the public. He emphasized respecting Bezos's privacy during his visit.'We're not going to nosy in a person's business. He comes here. He comes here as a tourist. He spends money in Montserrat. Thank God he's spending some money in Montserrat,' Meade said.Montserrat is widely known as 'The Emerald Isle of the Caribbean 'Montserrat, known as "The Emerald Isle of the Caribbean," boasts a population of approximately 4,386. Despite its beauty and growing tourism sector, parts of the island remain uninhabitable due to past volcanic activity, including the now-buried capital, Plymouth. The island is also known for its Irish heritage and annual St. Patrick’s Festival.
Article Summary: Jeff Bezos and fiancee Lauren Sanchez visited the Caribbean island of Montserrat aboard his $500 million superyacht, "Koru" The billionaire's visit sparked alarm among locals who feared the billionaire was scouting land for purchase. Prime Minister Reuben Meade, 70, attempted to quell these fears, clarifying that Bezos was visiting as a tourist.

Article Title: Masayoshi Son: AGI will come "much earlier," says SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son, as he unveil $3B AI partnership with OpenAI
Article Text:
SoftBank Group Corp. chairman and CEO Masayoshi Son, center left, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, center right, take a question after their meeting with Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba at the prime minister's office in Tokyo, Japan, Monday, Feb. 3 2025. (Franck Robichon/Pool Photo via AP)

SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son announced Monday that artificial general intelligence ( AGI ) will arrive "much earlier" than his previous two- to three-year prediction, as the company unveiled a major partnership with OpenAI to develop AI agent technology for the Japanese market .The partnership centers on " Cristal intelligence ," a new AI system that will be marketed exclusively to major Japanese companies through a joint venture called SB OpenAI Japan.The 50-50 partnership between SoftBank and OpenAI aims to accelerate the deployment of advanced AI systems across Japanese enterprises."This partnership with SoftBank will accelerate our vision for bringing transformative AI to some of the world's most influential companies, starting with Japan," OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said at the announcement event in Tokyo.The initiative comes as OpenAI pushes to expand its presence beyond its partnership with Microsoft. SoftBank will invest $3 billion to implement OpenAI's technology across its portfolio companies, including chip designer Arm and SoftBank Corp.Altman emphasized that AI agents represent the "next evolution beyond ChatGPT," with Cristal intelligence designed to automate knowledge work and adapt to each company's specific operations. SoftBank Corp. plans to "automate over 100 million workflows" using the technology, while Arm will utilize it to "drive innovation and boost productivity."The announcement follows OpenAI's recent release of Deep Research and o3 mini , showcasing the company's rapid advancement in AI capabilities. "Reasoning paves the way for AI agents, AI systems that can do work for you independently," Altman noted, adding, "We're going to look back in a few years at o3 and be like 'man, can you believe how bad that was?'"Son, who presented the announcement while holding a crystal ball, expressed confidence that AGI will be deployed first in large corporations in Japan and will eventually develop the ability to understand human emotions.
Article Summary: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son announced Monday that artificial general intelligence ( AGI ) will arrive "much earlier" than his previous two- to three-year prediction. SoftBank will invest $3 billion to implement OpenAI's technology across its portfolio companies, including chip designer Arm.

Article Title: Apple partners Elon Musk’s SpaceX to bring Starlink satellite services to iPhones

An Apple store (Image for representation)

Apple has teamed up with Elon Musk's SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite connectivity into iPhones. This feature allows iPhone users to send text messages via satellite, with plans to expand into data and voice services in the future.Unlike Apple's existing satellite service, which requires users to manually align their iPhones with satellites, the Starlink option works automatically, even when the phone is in a pocket.T-Mobile has initiated a limited beta program, inviting select iPhone users to test the Starlink integration. Participants received a message stating, "You’re in the T-Mobile Starlink beta. You can now stay connected with texting via satellite from virtually anywhere." The beta currently supports iPhone 14 and later models, with plans to expand to more users and eventually other countries.Elon Musk responded to the news on social media, highlighting that the current Starlink technology supports images, music, and podcasts, with future upgrades expected to add video support. Article Title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra first impressions: Carrying the legacy
Article Text:
Design

Display

Hardware and software

Camera

What we think

Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone – Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. With its sleek design, powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and top-tier camera capabilities, the S25 Ultra is designed to impress the consumers. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy.We got the chance to spend some time with the new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra and here’s our first impressions of the new Samsung smartphone.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra has borrowed its design aesthetics from its predecessor. The most expensive S series smartphone from Samsung continues the trend of refined aesthetics with a squared-off titanium frame and Gorilla Glass Armor 2. The Gorilla Glass Armor 2 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra is scratch resistant and it also provides anti-reflective glass ceramic cover the the smartphone. The design is both durable and elegant, with a slimmer and lighter build compared to its predecessors. The phone now features smoother, rounded corners, making it more comfortable to hold. The ride side of the smartphone houses the volume rockers and the power button. Apart from waking up the smartphone, the users can also use the power button to activate Google Gemini. The bottom part of the smartphone houses the USB Type C charging case, the slot for S Pen and the SIM card tray. The front is dominated by a 6.9-inch AMOLED display and the rear of the smartphone houses the quad-camera setup placed neatly in the top right corner. The smartphone also comes with IP68 rating which makes it resistant to dust and water. The overall build of Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra exudes sophistication, maintaining its status as a flagship device.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra sports a 6.9-inch Quad HD+ Infinity-O-Edge AMOLED display. The display on the smartphone offers a variable refresh rate of up to 120Hz. The screen is protected with a coating of Corning Gorilla Armor 2 glass which makes it resistant to scratches. We really liked the display on the flagship Samsung smartphone. It offers a crisp resolution, smooth 120Hz adaptive refresh rate, and enhanced Vision Booster for vivid outdoor viewing. Samsung has further enhanced brightness levels, making it easy to view even under harsh sunlight. The colour accuracy and HDR performance ensure vibrant visuals, whether you're gaming or streaming videos.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is powered by Android’s most powerful and advanced chipset – Snapdragon 8 Elite. The smartphone comes in three variants – 12GB+256GB, 12GB+512GB and 12GB + 1TB. The smartphone performed well during our initial testing and we didn’t face any lag. We had a smooth experience during multitasking and gaming. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is backed by a 5,000 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support. The smartphone also supports Qi wireless charging. Samsung claims that the smartphone can charge from 0to 65% in just 30 minutes. However, we are yet to test this functionality and the battery backup of the smartphone. The dual SIM smartphone comes equipped with an in- display fingerprint sensor and sports a quad rear camera setup.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra runs Android 15 operating system topped with the company's own layer of One UI 7. Samsung has also confirmed that the Galaxy S25 Ultra will get seven years of OS and security updates. Coming to One UI 7, the AI integration in One UI 7 feels more intuitive, with features like natural language search and context-aware multitasking. The AI features of the OS come with a significant new look, based on a new notification system that streamlines communication with easy access from the device's lock screen. It includes Now Bar, which highlights relevant activities across various features like Interpreter, Music, Recording, Stopwatch and more. One UI 7 also reduces visual clutter and offers a simplified homescreen, redesigned One UI widgets, and lock screen which enhances the user experience. We will talk more about the software in our detailed review of the smartphone.Same as its predecessor, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra also sports a quad rear camera setup. The rear camera consists of 200MP main camera with f/1.7 aperture, 50MP ultra wide sensor with f/1.9 aperture, 10MP telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom and f/2.4 aperture and 50MP periscope telephoto lens for 5x optical zoom and f/3.4 aperture. Front houses a 12MP selfie camera with f/2.2 aperture. The camera delivered some really impressive results during our initial testing. The primary sensor on the Galaxy S25 Ultra manages to capture incredible detail and dynamic range. The AI enhancements bring sharper portraits and more accurate colour reproduction. Features like depth-of-field control and Galaxy Log enhance creative possibilities and help users do much more with the camera. Also, the redesigned camera UX allows more intuitive control over advanced settings. Camera buttons, controls, and modes have been reorganised to make it easier to find the features you need and to give you a clearer preview of the picture you’re taking or the video you're recording. For the detailed camera analysis, you will have to wait for our detailed review.Overall, the Galaxy S25 Ultra feels like a refined iteration of an already impressive formula. Its snappier UI, AI enhancements, and polished design make it a top contender in the flagship smartphone segment. The smartphone offers a sleek design and all the high-end and powerful specifications. But will that be enough? Wait for our detailed review to find out more.
Article Summary: Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone – Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy. Article Title: Ratan Tata’s trusted manager Shantana Naidu shares a career update: It comes full circle now
Article Text:
Take a look at Shantana Naidu’s LinkedIn post



Ratan Tata and Shantanu Naidu's friendship journey

Ratan Tata’s trusted manager Shantana Naidu has shared a career update. Taking to professional networking platform LinkedIn, Naidu shared “I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as General Manager, Head - Strategic Initiatives at Tata Motors!”.He also reflected back on his family’s connection with the company. “I remember when my father used to walk home from the Tata motors plant, in his white shirt and navy pants, and I would wait for him in the window. It comes full circle now ❤️,” Naidu shared, posting a photo of himself with Tata Nano.Naidu, a fifth-generation Tata Group employee, first met Ratan Tata in 2014. They connected over their shared love for animals when Naidu launched a project to protect stray dogs by designing glow-in-the-dark collars to prevent road accidents. Seeking funding for the initiative, Naidu reached out to Tata, who showed interest and invited him to Mumbai. This collaboration on Naidu’s project, Motopaws, sparked a lasting friendship.Together, Naidu and Tata later founded Goodfellows, a company that connects young people with senior citizens for companionship. Naidu has a deep appreciation for older generations, saying, “many of my closest friends have silver hair and hearts of gold.” Although he briefly went to the U.S. for an MBA, he returned to keep his promise to continue working with Tata.After his return, Naidu became Tata’s assistant and the youngest general manager at Tata Trusts. Their bond grew stronger over time, with Tata even attending Naidu’s graduation. In his book “Came Upon a Lighthouse”, Naidu fondly refers to Tata as a “Millennial Dumbledore,” highlighting the valuable life lessons he gained from their relationship.
Article Summary: Ratan Tata's trusted manager Shantana Naidu has shared a career update on LinkedIn. He is starting a new position as General Manager, Head - Strategic Initiatives at Tata Motors. He and Tata first met in 2014 when he launched a project to protect stray dogs with glow-in-the-dark collars.

Article Title: Satellite Revolution: A New Dawn for India's Digital Landscape
Article Text:
-- By Sandeep Arora, Vice President and Industry Platform Leader for Telecom, India, Capgemini

India stands on the brink of a transformative shift in its digital evolution, with satellite internet poised to be the game changer. What was once considered a niche technology is now set to become the cornerstone of the country’s rural connectivity strategy, reshaping its socio-economic landscape. This is not just an upgrade in technology; it is a big opportunity to bridge the digital divide that has long separated millions from the benefits of the modern world.With a unique mix of geographic diversity, infrastructure limitations, and socio-economic challenges, India is yet to fully tap the broadband market potential.Bridging this access gap will empower millions with the opportunities essential for progress in today’s world. Satellite technology can reach the farthest corners of rural India, opening doors to education, healthcare, and economic opportunities.Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites are emerging as a maturing technology. With ongoing efforts from telecom and satellite companies, combined with supportive government policies such as 100% foreign direct investment (FDI) in satellite manufacturing components, the groundwork is being laid for a new wave of connectivity in rural development.Revolutionizing EducationImagine a classroom in a remote village where students have access to virtual lessons, can interact with peers from around the globe, and tap into a vast repository of educational resources. Satellite internet will make this vision a reality. By bringing reliable connectivity to even the most isolated locations, the technology will empower students and educators alike, creating a new generation of rural innovators and entrepreneurs. This transformative connectivity will enable interactive and immersive learning experiences previously confined to urban areas, ultimately bridging the educational gap.Transforming HealthcareIn the field of healthcare, satellite internet has the potential to revolutionize medical access in underserved regions. By enabling real-time consultations between rural health centres and urban specialists, satellite technology will enhance healthcare outcomes across the country. Digitalizing clinics and integrating telehealth capabilities will connect thousands of doctors to rural patients, facilitating remote consultations and expert medical advice. This connectivity will be crucial in delivering quality healthcare services in disadvantaged areas, ensuring no one is left behind.Advancing Precision AgricultureAgriculture stands to benefit profoundly from the integration of satellite internet. The technology promises to transform farming practices, enabling precision agriculture that optimizes water use, boosts crop yields, and reduces pesticide reliance. As satellite internet becomes widespread and affordable, millions of farmers across India will gain access to advanced tools and insights, enhancing agricultural productivity. This technological advancement will also bolster resilience against climate change, making farming practices more sustainable and efficient.Enhancing Financial ServicesSatellite internet will drive a surge in digital financial services in rural areas. It will increase the percentage of rural adults using digital banking, reduce the cost of remittances, and improve insurance penetration. Satellite technology will enable the expansion of the rural financial landscape, accelerating the adoption of digital banking and fintech solutions. As a result, millions in rural pockets of the country will be able to enter the formal financial system, promoting economic inclusion.Strengthening Disaster ManagementDuring natural disasters, effective communication can be a matter of life and death. Natural disasters can damage essential communication networks and infrastructure, impacting their functionality and capacity. Satellite internet will provide a critical lifeline, offering reliable and uninterrupted connectivity during emergencies. This capability will enhance disaster management efforts, ensuring timely responses and coordination that can save lives and minimize damage.Navigating Challenges and OpportunitiesDespite the immense potential, challenges remain. The need for affordable ground terminals, the environmental impact of satellite launches, and secure data transmission between satellites and ground stations must be addressed. As connectivity improves, addressing digital literacy and developing relevant local content will be crucial to ensuring that the benefits of satellite internet are fully realized.The journey ahead will require collaborative efforts from policymakers, industry leaders, and communities. As satellite internet evolves, it is essential for these stakeholders to work together to overcome the existing challenges and maximize the technology’s potential. The satellite revolution represents a new dawn for India’s digital landscape. It is an opportunity to bridge the digital divide, empower rural communities, and unlock unprecedented potential for growth and socio-economic development. Satellite technology promises to redefine India’s future, bringing the promise of connectivity and opportunity to every corner of the country.
Article Summary: India stands on the brink of a transformative shift in its digital evolution. What was once considered a niche technology is now set to become the cornerstone of the country’s rural connectivity strategy. Satellite technology can reach the farthest corners of rural India, opening doors to education, healthcare, and economic opportunities.

The company stated that these reductions specifically target individuals not meeting performance expectations. Business Insider initially reported, citing sources, that the layoffs include members of Microsoft's security division. A Microsoft spokesperson confirmed the job cuts but declined to disclose the total number of affected employees.Despite the global layoffs, Microsoft's India and South Asia head, Puneet Chandok, has assured that the company's India operations will not be affected by this latest round of job cuts.Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has announced plans to lay off approximately 3,600 employees deemed to be low performers. In an internal memo obtained by Bloomberg, CEO Mark Zuckerberg confirmed the move, explaining that it is a strategy to “raise the bar on performance management and move out low-performers faster.”These layoffs, impacting roughly 5% of Meta's 72,400-person workforce (as of September), are part of what Zuckerberg has described as an "intense year" for the company. Employees in the US will be notified of their status by February 10, while international employees will be informed at a later date, according to new agency AFP.Amazon announced late last month that it is implementing layoffs within its communications and sustainability divisions as part of an organisational restructuring effort. The precise number of affected employees has not been revealed, though it was described as “small” in an internal memo obtained by CNBC.Drew Herdener, who leads public relations and corporate responsibility at Amazon, informed staff of the cuts, explaining in a memo that the company needs to eliminate roles that are “too narrowly scoped” or create “unnecessary layers” within the organisation. Amazon substantially downsized its workforce with over 27,000 employees throughout 2022, 2023 and 2024.Last week reports said that Google has offered a voluntary exit programme to US-based employees within its Platforms & Devices organisation, the division responsible for key products like Android, Pixel, Chrome, and Nest. The program, announced via an internal memo from Senior Vice President Rick Osterloh and first reported by 9to5Google, offers severance packages to employees who choose to leave the division.“The Platforms & Devices team is offering a voluntary exit program that provides US-based Googlers working on this team the ability to voluntarily leave the company with a severance package,” a Google spokesperson confirmed.The voluntary exit option is available to teams working across a range of products, including Android (encompassing Auto, TV, Wear OS, and XR), Chrome, ChromeOS, Google Photos, Google One, Pixel, Fitbit, and Nest.Salesforce is the latest company that has been reported to be planning to cut over 1,000 jobs as part of its ongoing restructuring efforts. Bloomberg News reported that the company is simultaneously hiring new employees to support its expansion into Al-driven products.Notably, displaced workers will be able to apply for other jobs internally. It could not be determined which divisions the reductions were focused on.Stripe has announced the layoff of 300 employees, primarily impacting roles in product, engineering, and operations, according to an internal memo dated January 20. Despite this decision, Chief People Officer Rob McIntosh noted in the memo that the company plans to grow its overall workforce to around 10,000 employees by the year's end.
Article Summary: Microsoft has confirmed another round of layoffs, impacting employees across various divisions. Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has announced plans to lay off approximately 3,600 employees deemed to be low performers. Amazon substantially downsized its workforce with over 27,000 employees throughout 2022, 2023 and 2024. Google has offered a voluntary exit programme to US-based employees within its Platforms & Devices organisation.

Article Title: Millionaire Bryan Johnson 'walked out' of Nikhil Kamath's podcast, says: The problem was …
Article Text: Tech millionaire Bryan Johnson has addressed reports of him walking out midway through a podcast with Nikhil Kamath . During the conversation, Johnson, wearing a face mask, made a lighthearted remark about the poor air quality. When Kamath inquired about how bad it was, Johnson jokingly replied, “I can’t see you over there.”Explaining his abrupt exit on X (formerly known as Twitter), Johnson wrote “When in India, I did end this podcast early due to the bad air quality.@nikhilkamathcio was a gracious host and we were having a great time. The problem was that the room we were in circulated outside air which made the air purifier I'd brought with me ineffective.”He further highlighted: “The room’s Air Quality Index (AQI) was 130, with PM2.5 levels at 75 µg/m³ — equivalent to smoking 3.4 cigarettes a day.”By his third day in India, Johnson said the pollution had caused his “skin break out in rash and my eyes and throat burn.” He expressed disbelief at how normalized air pollution seemed, noting, “People would be outside running. Babies and small children exposed from birth. No one wore a mask which can significantly decrease exposure. It was so confusing.”Johnson also highlighted the significant impact on public health. He wrote:The evidence shows that India would improve the health of its population more by cleaning up air quality than by curing all cancers.I am unsure why India's leaders do not make air quality a national emergency. I don't know what interests, money and power keep things the way they are but it's really bad for the entire country.When I returned to the U.S., my eyes were fresh to see what is normalized to me. I saw obesity everywhere. 42.4% of American are obese and because I was around it all the time, I had been mostly oblivious to it.In many contexts, obesity is worse than air pollution in the long term.Why wouldn't American leaders declare a national emergency on obesity? What interests, money and power keep things the way they are but are really bad for the entire country.Johnson’s post has gone viral now with over 2 million views so far.
Article Summary: Tech millionaire Bryan Johnson has addressed reports of him walking out midway through a podcast with Nikhil Kamath. Johnson, wearing a face mask, made a lighthearted remark about the poor air quality. When Kamath inquired about how bad it was, Johnson jokingly replied, “I can’t see you over there.”

Article Title: CTO Shyam Sankar of Palantir which has large government contracts happy with Elon Musk's DOGE
Article Text:
Palantir CEO also praises DOGE

Palantir CTO Shyam Sankar has voiced his support for Elon Musk 's leadership of the newly-formed Department of Governmental Efficiency ( DOGE ), expressing optimism that it will usher in an era of “meritocracy and transparency” within government.During the Q4 2024 earnings call, Sankar was asked how Palantir is positioned to take advantage of the potential opportunities presented by the change in administration and the focus on efficiencies, software modernisation, and digitalisation. He said that the company’s “real competition is a lack of accountability in government.”“These forever software projects that cost an insane amount that don't actually deliver results, they're sacred cows of the deep state. You can think about D6A, it cost billions of dollars and it didn't work. Soldiers and -- Soldiers in war zones preferred Palantir because it worked and it happened to only cost millions of dollars,” he said.“And I think DOGE is going to bring meritocracy and transparency to [the] government and that’s exactly what our commercial business is. The commercial market is meritocratic and transparent and you see the results that we have in that sort of environment and that's the basis of our optimism around this,” he added.Alex Karp , the cofounder and CEO of Palantir, said DOGE will be good for Americans and the company.“We love disruption, and whatever is good for America will be good for Americans and very good for Palantir," Karp said.“Disruption, at the end of the day, exposes things that aren't working. There will be ups and downs. There's a revolution. Some people are going to get their heads cut off. We're expecting to see really unexpected things and to win,” he added.
Article Summary: Palantir CTO Shyam Sankar has voiced his support for Elon Musk's leadership of the newly-formed Department of Governmental Efficiency. He expressed optimism that it will usher in an era of “meritocracy and transparency” within government.

Article Title: Netflix removes actress Karla Sofia Gascon from posters of Oscar nominated movie Emilia Perez
Article Text:
Gascon faces backlash over offensive tweets

Netflix has reportedly removed transgender actress Karla Sofia Gascon from promotional materials for its Oscar-nominated film Emilia Perez. This comes a month ahead of the 97th Academy Awards. Several users on social media platforms like X/Twitter and Reddit noted that the streamer appeared to be downplaying Gascon's presence in their Oscar campaign for the film.“Karla Sofia Gascon has been completely erased from the latest Oscars ' For Your Consideration ' ad for Emilia Perez. I wonder why!??,” wrote a user on X, sharing an image of promotional material of the film on Netflix.“New Netflix FYC poster for Emilia Perez without Karla on it oh it’s OVER lmaooo,” wrote another user on X.Gascon, 52, made history as the first openly transgender actress to receive a Best Actress nomination for her portrayal of the film’s titular character. However, promotional materials for the 'For Your Consideration' (FYC) campaign appeared to center on Best Supporting Actress nominee Zoe Saldana, 46. Saldana, who earned her first career Oscar nomination for playing Rita in the Spanish-language film, is widely considered the frontrunner for the award.In a related news, Gascon has faced intense backlash over offensive tweets she posted in the past five years, with remarks about George Floyd, Islam, and diversity at the Oscars sparking widespread criticism. The controversy has quickly overshadowed her awards campaign, drawing significant public and industry scrutiny.In an emotional hour-long interview with CNN en Espanol, Gascon insisted she is not “a racist” as she tearfully addressed her past social media posts. Speaking with interviewer Juan Carlos Arciniegas, she was asked whether she would renounce her historic Oscar nomination—the first ever for an openly transgender actor. Gascon firmly refused, stating, “I cannot renounce a nomination because what I have done is a job, and what is being valued is my acting work,” as translated by The Hollywood Reporter.She further defended her position, saying, “I cannot step down from an Oscar nomination because I have not committed any crime nor have I harmed anyone. Article Title: US Justice Department has a ‘problem’ with Hewlett-Packard Enterprise’s $14 billion acquisition of Juniper
Article Text:
What HPE and Juniper said about the lawsuit



“We will vigorously defend against the Department of Justice’s overreaching interpretation of

antitrust laws

and will demonstrate how this transaction will provide customers with greater innovation and choice, positively change the dynamics in the networking market.”

What DOJ said about HPE’s Juniper acquisition



“The proposed transaction between HPE and Juniper, if allowed to proceed, would further consolidate an already highly concentrated market — and leave U.S. enterprises facing two companies commanding over 70% of the market,”

The US Justice Department (DOJ) has filed a lawsuit to block Hewlett Packard Enterprise 's (HPE) proposed $14 billion acquisition of rival Juniper Networks. The lawsuit, the first attempt by the Trump administration to stop a merger, alleges that HPE, facing increased competition from Juniper, opted to buy its rival instead of continuing to innovate and compete. The DOJ said that the merger would stifle competition, lead to higher prices, and reduce innovation in the networking industry. Last year, HPE revealed plans to acquire Juniper Networks for $40 per share in a deal which is expected to double the buyer’s networking business.HPE and Juniper released a joint statement that both companies strongly opposed the DOJ’s decision. The companies stated that the merged entity would increase competition, not hinder it.In the statement, HPE and Juniper wrote:In its complaint, the DOJ portrayed HPE as a company struggling to keep pace with a smaller competitor that was gaining market share.The complaint noted that HPE’s salespeople were worried about the "Juniper threat" and cited one former executive urging his team to adopt a no-holds-barred approach, telling them that "there are no rules in a street fight" and encouraging them to "kill" Juniper in sales competitions.The DOJ also stated that HPE and Juniper are the second and third-largest providers of wireless local area network (WLAN) products and services for businesses in the US, adding that Cisco Systems was the industry leader.DOJ said in the complaint.
Article Summary: The US Justice Department has filed a lawsuit to block Hewlett Packard Enterprise's proposed $14 billion acquisition of rival Juniper Networks. The lawsuit, the first attempt by the Trump administration to stop a merger, alleges that HPE, facing increased competition from Juniper, opted to buy its rival instead of continuing to innovate and compete.

Article Title: Microsoft founder Bill Gates: I told Steve Jobs that I see the bullshit, you ...
Article Text:
Bill Gates says Steve Jobs “should have been an actor”

Steve Jobs had “many skills that I didn’t”: Bill Gates

Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates recently shared candid thoughts about his relationship with Steve Jobs Apple , and pivotal moments in tech history during an interview with Axios. The conversation coincides with the release of Gates' new memoir, Source Code, which chronicles the early days of the computer industry.Reflecting on Steve Jobs, Gates called the late Apple co-founder a "singular figure" who had an extraordinary ability to captivate people."He should have been an actor," Gates said. "He really ran the reality distortion field like no one else."Despite Jobs' persuasive charisma, Gates claims he was never under his spell. "I always said to Steve, 'Look, I'm a minor wizard. You're a major wizard. You can cast spells I can't cast, but because I'm a minor wizard, your spells don't work on me. I see the bullshit, that you're just mesmerizing these people.'"Gates recalled a particularly blunt exchange after Jobs unveiled the NeXT computer , a machine that struggled commercially. "This thing is a slow, expensive computer with an overpriced black case," Gates told Jobs at the time.While Gates admired Jobs' "messianic" skills in marketing and leadership, he also noted the late Apple co-founder’s lack of technical expertise. "Steve's achievements are all the more impressive when you know that he couldn't look at a piece of code and know what it was," Gates said. "He was never an engineer. Woz [Steve Wozniak] was a real engineer — I mean, a hardcore engineer."Despite their differing skill sets and approaches, Gates acknowledged that he and Jobs shared one key talent: the ability to inspire their teams. "Clearly, he had so many skills that I didn't, but we were both a little bit pied pipers in terms of getting people to work ridiculous hours," Gates said.The conversation also touched on Microsoft's pivotal role in saving Apple from bankruptcy in 1997, when it invested in the struggling company and pledged support. Gates said he has no regrets about the move. "It was good that Apple recovered and made incredible contributions," he said. "Once you get to the mobile thing, then Apple becomes every bit as important as Microsoft. It wasn't up until then. They were more of a niche."However, Gates admitted that selling Microsoft’s 5% stake in Apple, acquired as part of the deal, was a mistake. "I wish we'd maintained that 5% ownership," he said with a laugh. "It was foolish, foolish to sell it, but when we're worrying about all sorts of antitrust things, we sold it for what now looks like nothing. And we owned part of Facebook for a while, too."
Article Summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates recently shared candid thoughts about his relationship with Steve Jobs. The conversation coincides with the release of Gates' new memoir, Source Code. Gates called Jobs a "singular figure" who had an extraordinary ability to captivate people.
